N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 515.4 - Guidelines for sanctions

State Regulations
(a) A sanction may be imposed at the
discretion of the department upon a determination that a person has engaged in
one or more unacceptable practices. (b) In determining the sanction to be
imposed, the following factors will be considered: (1)
the number and nature of the program
violations or other related offenses; (2)
the nature and extent of any adverse
impact the violations have had on recipients; (3)
the amount of damages to the
program; (4)
mitigating
circumstances; (5)
other facts
related to the nature and seriousness of the violations; and
(6)
the previous record of the person under
the Medicare, Medicaid and social services programs. Notes
